title: Drag and drop onto bookmark icon no longer works Firefox 120.01 (2023)
content:
Two computers. Both computers name version of Firefox and same version Of Windows 10. On computer 1 drag and drop no longer works. I can click star next url and manually to bookmark toolbar. I also cannot reorder on tool bar by dragging and dropping by selecting.

How do I know I'm doing it correctly? On computer 2 it works exactly as should. Click on padlock and drop or click on entry and toolbar and reorder. Same extensions etc and do not have a bookmark extension though have tab session manager. Same version both computers. Only difference in browser is number of tabs open. x 10 difference in number of tabs open computer 1 versus 2.

If I put firefox in troubleshoot mode with extensions etc off or create a brand new profile and try same problem.

title: Firefox Extensions Not Showing On Toolbar
content:
I see where other people have posed this question but the procedure offered is not available to me.

I am using Firefox (Flatpak) version 121.0 on an Ubuntu 22.04 laptop.

On installing a new extension I should either see the extension's icon on my toolbar or else have a clear means of adding it. I have neither.

Clicking on the jigsaw icon in the toolbar, I get migrated to the about:addons page. On clicking the Extensions tab, I get the screen listing all installed extensions. Each extension has a ... icon beside it. But when I click on this, there is no "Pin To Toolbar" option.

What is wrong here ?

No dia-a-dia uso somente o Firefox.

Obrigado.

Raf.
creator: r.finzi

title: Microsoft 365 SharePoint home page refreshes over and over; Microsoft says "Cloudflare/Firefox issue"
content:
I contacted Microsoft Support for this issue and they sent me here.

My organization uses SharePoint Online. On our home page, we're using all native Microsoft web parts, and we're not pulling anything in (to our knowledge) from third parties. It's all content being pulled from resources in our in SharePoint Online environment.

When Firefox users go to our home page, it refreshes every few seconds. Sometimes 2-3 times and then it settles, but sometimes it's indefinitely and you just end up closing the browser. Microsoft had me run a trace and they told me that they found some weirdness with "Cloudflare" causing Firefox to load over and over. As far as I know, my organization doesn't do anything with Cloudflare. They couldn't really give me much else to go on. I'd never even heard of Cloudflare before this.

Does this sound legit or, is Microsoft passing the buck?

We are seeing this issue with multiple users, including myself. It ONLY happens with Firefox.
creator: mattgudites

title: La finestra si blocca durante i caricamenti
content: Ogni volta che inserisco informazioni in un relativo campo e premo sul relativo pulsante associato (invia, cerca, successivo, ...), c'è un 50% di possibilità che l'intera finestra si blocchi. Ogni azione porterà la relativa scheda a rimanere bloccata cercando di caricare la pagina successiva. Una volta che ciò accade in una scheda, accadrà per tutte le schede aperte nella stessa finestra, rendendo l'intera sessione di Firefox inutilizzabile.Bisogna dunque chiudere il tutto, riaprire una nuova sessione, ripristinare le schede chiuse di recente e fare da capo quel che si stava facendo. Ad esempio, mi conviene copiare il contenuto di questo messaggio in quanto, no appena proverò ad inviarlo, l'intero sito potrebbe bloccarsi costringendomi a chiuderre la finestra e scrivere tutto da capo. Inutile descrivere quanto limitante questo problema sia, specialmente se ci sono anche altre schede aperte che diventeranno inutilizzabili di conseguenza. Il problema si sta presentando da circa un mese, Firefox dovrebbe già aver rilasciato un paio di aggiornamenti (che ho immediatamente installato) ed io non ho modificato alcuna impostazione in quel periodo. Spero in una risposta e/o soluzione, altrimenti mi troverò costretto a cambiare browser a causa delle limitazioni qui spiegate.
creator: cava98andrea
